newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan PM wants land liquidity plan by end-Mar - MOF.
newsitem.headline: Japan PM wants land liquidity plan by end-Mar - MOF.

text.p: Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto told Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka on Tuesday to draw up measures by the end of March to improve land liquidity, Mitsuzuka told a news conference.

Mitsuzuka said Hashimoto told him that promoting the disposal of problem loans held by financial firms and activating markets through improving liquidity of collateralisted real estate was important for Japan's financial and securities industries and for its economy.
Hashimoto also said it was necessary to come up with an overall liquidity plan that included securitisation of collateralised real estate and effective use of land.
Hashimoto told Mitsuzuka he acknowledged that the Finance Ministry had set up a forum last October in cooperation with other ministries to discuss such issues.

Mitsuzuka said Hashimoto told him to come up with an overall scheme to improve liquidity of collateralised land during March at the forum in cooperation with the Construction Ministry, the National Land Agency and the Justice Ministry.
